DOC.HEADLINE: KEN CARSON ; COWBOY SINGER WITH THE SONS OF THE PIONEERS
DOC.TEXT: Ken Carson , 79 , cowboy singer with the Sons of the Pioneers.He joined the group in 1942 after its founding member , Roy Rogers , left to make Western films . The tenor remembered for the phrase " cool , clear water , " Carson sang on " Cool Water " and " Tumbling Tumbleweeds , " the group ' s two most famous records . Also a musician , Carson appeared in 22 of Rogers ' movies as a member of the musical_group that backed_up Rogers when he sang . Born in Coalgate , Okla. , Carson moved to California as a child . On Thursday in Delray Beach , Fla. , of amyotrophic_lateral_sclerosis , commonly known as Lou Gehrig ' s disease .
